00022 #ifndef NEWTS_NOTE_H
00023 #define NEWTS_NOTE_H
00024 
00025 #include "newts/config.h"
00026 #include "newts/author.h"
00027 #include "newts/notesfile.h"
00028 
00029 /* enum note_statuses - the various statuses which a note can have.
00030  *
00031  * ANONYMOUS      - Flag to indicate that note was anonymous.
00032  * CONFIDENTIAL   - Hide author from everybody but directors.
00033  * LOCKED         - Note is locked; no further responses allowed.
00034  * DELETED        - Note has been deleted.
00035  * UNAPPROVED     - Note needs moderator approval before displaying.
00036  * ANNOUNCEMENT   - Note is only reply-able by directors.
00037  *                  (Would like a better name for this.)
00038  * DIRECTORS_ONLY - Note is only viewable by directors.
00039  * WRITEONLY      - Note was written by a user without read permission.
00040  * STICKY         - Note should appear at the top of the index.
00041  * CORRUPTED      - Note has been determined to be corrupted.
00042  */
00043 
00044 enum note_statuses
00045   {
00046     NOTE_ANONYMOUS      = 01,
00047     NOTE_CONFIDENTIAL   = 02,
00048     NOTE_LOCKED         = 04,
00049     NOTE_DELETED        = 010,
00050     NOTE_UNAPPROVED     = 020,        /* Same value as NF_MODERATED. */
00051     NOTE_ANNOUNCEMENT   = 040,
00052     NOTE_DIRECTORS_ONLY = 0100,
00053     NOTE_WRITE_ONLY     = 0200,
00054     NOTE_STICKY         = 0400,
00055     NOTE_CORRUPTED      = 01000
00056   };
00057 
00058 /* enum write_options - options to take into account when adding new notes.
00059  *
00060  * ADD_POLICY      - The note is the new policy note for the notesfile.
00061  * UPDATE_TIMES    - Set the 'last modified' time for the note to right now.
00062  * ADD_ID          - Generate a new unique ID for the note.  Otherwise, use the
00063  *                   ID in the note as provided.
00064  * SKIP_MODERATION - Set the moderation status of the note equal to the
00065  *                   moderation status of the note as provided.  Otherwise, set
00066  *                   the new note as unapproved (if the notesfile is moderated
00067  *                   in the first place).  This should only be used by the
00068  *                   nfload program, and internally (e.g. during notesfile
00069  *                   compression).
00070  */
00071 
00072 enum write_options
00073   {
00074     ADD_POLICY      = 01,
00075     UPDATE_TIMES    = 02,
00076     ADD_ID          = 04,
00077     SKIP_MODERATION = 010
00078   };
00079 
00080 /* struct newtid - a "unique id" for each newt created.
00081  *
00082  * SYSTEM - the system FQDN the note was created on.
00083  * NUMBER - the "unique" ID number.
00084  */
00085 
00086 struct newtid
00087 {
00088   char *system;
00089   long number;
00090 };
00091 
00092 /* struct newtref - a reference to a particular newt.
00093  *
00094  * NFR     - a reference to the notesfile the newt lives in.
00095  * NOTENUM - the number of the basenote this newt belongs to.
00096  * RESPNUM - the response number of the newt; if the actual basenote is
00097  *           desired, this should be 0.
00098  */
00099 
00100 struct newtref
00101 {
00102   struct nfref nfr;
00103   int notenum;
00104   int respnum;
00105 };
00106 
00107 /* struct newt - metadata about a particular newt.
00108  *
00109  * NR               - the newt reference for this newt.
00110  * ID               - the "unique" ID of the newt.
00111  * TITLE            - the title of the basenote of this newt.
00112  * DIRECTOR_MESSAGE - the director message for this newt.
00113  * AUTH             - the author of the newt.
00114  * CREATED          - the time this newt was created.
00115  * MODIFIED         - the most recent time this newt was modified; used by the
00116  *                    sequencer.
00117  * TOTAL_RESPS      - the total number of responses to the current basenote.
00118  * TEXT             - the text of the newt.
00119  * OPTIONS          - a bitmap of enum note_statuses.
00120  */
00121 
00122 struct newt
00123 {
00124   struct newtref nr;
00125   struct newtid id;
00126   char *title;
00127   char *director_message;
00128   struct author auth;
00129   time_t created;
00130   time_t modified;
00131   int total_resps;
00132   char *text;
00133   int options;
00134 };
00135 
00136 #ifdef __cplusplus
00137 extern "C" {
00138 #endif
00139 
00140 extern inline int delete_note (struct newtref *nrp);
00141 extern inline int get_note (struct newt *notep, short updatestats);
00142 extern inline int modify_note (struct newt *notep, int flags);
00143 extern inline int modify_note_text (struct newt *notep);
00144 extern inline int write_note (struct notesfile *nf, struct newt *notep,
00145                               int flags);
00146 
00147 #ifdef __cplusplus
00148 }
00149 #endif
00150 
00151 #endif /* not NEWTS_NOTE_H */
